The given Node.js code is exporting a module. It imports a certain module named `index` and accesses its default export. Then, it re-exports this default entity from the current module. This essentially makes the default export of the `index` module available as the export of the current module.

Hereâ€™s the rewritten code:

```javascript
"use strict";

const indexModule = require("./index");
const defaultExport = indexModule.default;

module.exports = defaultExport;
```
